intro: Forsteronia obscura, commonly known as the dark forsteria, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and hairy, oval-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
